page.title: 13GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area is between Oakham,Langham, Ashwell and Burley,near the centre is the crossroads where the Oakham to Ashwell and the Langham to Burley roads cross.Most of the land is agricultural with grazing,cereals,and oil seed rape,but from the crossroads north on the left hand side are the Cottesmore Hunt Kennels,and on the right hand side going north are a small housing estate,originally built to house prison officers;Ashwell Prison;and the maintenance depot for Leicestershire County Council Road Services Department.These three features take up most of the land in this area in a 'ribbon development' which ends with a small Garden Centre. The Birmingham to East Coast railway line runs through the area,and beside this are the remains of the Melton Mowbray to Oakham Canal.
